intro: Strychnos oblonga, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces woody, elliptical berries that contain seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and thickets. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
